channel.title: possible disk damage
channel.description:
warning,hard to see ![](upload://orh6zvxxXZS21d5W5PkC1uZ4yFN.jpeg)
this is the metal gear solid 4 disk,single player runs fine,but metal gear online just sends me back to the XMB,people say mgo is sensitive to edge damage the thing shown in the picture is a white blur which i can see through, and spot the cache,just like any other disk
any suggestion for cleaning?it wont come out with any cloth :jizz:

item.title: possible disk damage
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
I’ve seen LCD monitors, Laptop screens, Projectors and Cell phones with non-removable spots on the inside.

Read full topic

item.title: possible disk damage
item.dc:creator: felipedomaul
item.description:
well,i would,if i didn’t live in brazil
but whatever,i’ll go to a local technology-only mall and see if anyone can fix it,if not,bye bye metal gear online
by the way,the smudge is in fact inside,that’s against the laws of physics!

Read full topic

item.title: possible disk damage
item.dc:creator: coldroll
item.description:
You are very unlucky just return the game and ask for a new copy.

Read full topic

item.title: possible disk damage
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
felipedomaul:

INVINCIBLE smudge

It’s been a while I’ve heard anyone say this, “INVINCIBLE smudge” only applies to disks lol…

Actually most likely you can’t do anything if it’s in between the 2 plastic layers the disk is made of…

Read full topic

item.title: possible disk damage
item.dc:creator: nunzilla
item.description:
Looks to me like it’s inside the disc, am I correct? Was it like that when you got it? It looks like something similar to a CD I bought a while back, kinda like some junk got in between the layers of the disc during the sandwiching process (or whatever the hell you call it). I’d contact the manufacturer. I know for sure that Best Buy or any other electronics store aren’t going to do squat for you.

Read full topic

item.title: possible disk damage
item.dc:creator: russilker
item.description:
I would bring it back to the store. Invisible smudges (in my experience, at least) tend to be from mistakes during the manufacturing process and are irreversible.

Read full topic

item.title: possible disk damage
item.dc:creator: felipedomaul
item.description:
Jingles:

Toothpaste into any ridges can help, not sure if it is a scratch though (picture is hard to see)

it’s more like a smudge,an INVINCIBLE smudge
won’t toothpaste damage my disk?

Read full topic
